```{r}
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
library(broom)
library(ggpubr)
```

```{r}
temp.data <- data.frame(
  squeaks = c(882,1188,1104,864,1200,1032,960,900),
  temperature = c(69.7,93.3,84.3,76.3,88.6,82.6,71.6,79.6)
)

temp.data
```

```{r}
plot(temp.data$temperature, temp.data$squeaks)
## create a "linear model" - that is, do the regression
temp.regression <- lm(squeaks ~ temperature, data=temp.data)
## add the regression line to our x/y scatter plot
abline(temp.regression, col="blue")

```

```{r}
summary(temp.regression)
```

```{r}
temp.graph <-ggplot(temp.data, aes(x=temperature, y=squeaks))+
                     geom_point()
temp.graph
```

```{r}
par(mfrow=c(2,2))
plot(temp.regression)
par(mfrow=c(1,1))
```

```{r}
temp.regression
```
